subject: Re: [junit] creating more assertX methods
msgSnippet: ... Agreed.  The expected/actual output message would need to be generated from the assertion itself, and the functors fall short.  The original post mentioned
messageBody:
David Roussel wrote:

>

> I think reason Matt thought new asserts would be a good idea is the
> automatic error messages you get. With assertEquals it not only tells
> you that the test failed, but also the actual and expected values that
> caused the test to fail.
>
> Using functors does not add this extra value.
>

Agreed. The expected/actual output message would need to be generated
from the assertion itself, and the functors fall short. The original
post mentioned subclassing Assert, but I think a new assertion class
could stand on its own.

Mike
